title: How to Be Medea? Summon Your Anger and Despair, and Hit the Gym.
description: Sondra Radvanovsky has taken on one of opera’s most grueling roles. “You can’t just act it,” she said. “You really have to live it.”
dc:creator: Javier C. Hernández
media:credit: George Etheredge for The New York Times
media:description: The soprano Sondra Radvanovsky did boxing sessions with a trainer to build stamina and strength for singing the title role in “Medea” at the Metropolitan Opera.
